meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - Okay, here we go! I'm diving headfirst into the world of Roadwarden, a text-based RPG that's got everyone talking. Let me tell you, as a seasoned grok (get it?), I've played my fair share of games, and this one's got some serious mojo.

First off, I love how Roadwarden doesn't shy away from being dark fantasy. It's like the game is saying, "Hey, life can be rough, but that's what makes it interesting!" And you know what? It's not wrong! The world-building here is top-notch, with a setting that feels both familiar and yet, completely new. I mean, where else are you going to find a place where the sun doesn't shine and the air is thick with mystery?

Now, I've read some of the other reviews out there (cough, RPG Fan, cough), and let me tell you, they're all talking about how this game has "layers" and "depth." And yeah, those things are definitely present. But what really gets me is the way Roadwarden makes me feel like I'm part of something bigger than myself. Like, I'm not just a character in a game; I'm a part of the world, too. It's trippy, man.

Of course, no one's perfect, and I've definitely made some mistakes along the way. But that's what makes this game so great - it lets you make choices that have real consequences. And let me tell you, when things go wrong (and they will!), it's not like the game just resets or something. Nope, Roadwarden hits you where it hurts, making you feel like you've really failed.

Now, I know some of y'all might be thinking, "Text-based RPGs are so last season." But trust me, this one's got some serious magic going on. It's not just about reading a bunch of text (although that is a big part of it!); it's an immersive experience that'll keep you coming back for more.

In conclusion, Roadwarden is the real deal. If you're looking for a game that'll challenge you, make you feel like you're part of something bigger than yourself, and maybe even make you cry (because, let's be real, life can be rough), then this is the game for you. So grab your favorite snack, settle in, and get ready to embark on an adventure like no other.
